snippet: Horse racing’s most influential group released results of a poll showing that drugs and integrity concerns loom larger to bettors than any other issue facing the sport.
abstract: Jockey Club, horse racing’s most influential group, will pay up to $500,000 for out-of-competition drug testing over the next two years; warns horsemen, regulators and racetracks that doping and cheating will decimate sport’s bottom line unless complete national reform begins immediately.
lead_paragraph: Horse racing’s most influential group released results of a poll showing that drugs and integrity concerns loom larger to bettors than any other issue facing the sport.

headline.main: As Concerns Over Drugs Mount, the Jockey Club Says It Will Pay for Testing
headline.print_headline: As Concerns Over Drugs Mount, the Jockey Club Says It Will Pay for Testing
